repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Upper and Middle Sao Francisco
            Irrigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Upper and Middle Sao Francisco
            Irrigation Project. The project's overall performance
            and development impact were unsatisfactory. The
            implementation for the components of the project was
            unsatisfactory. The project did not reach key appraisal
            targets during the period of non-disbursement. Where
            progress was less than satisfactory, the lack of performance
            was partly due to circumstances created by the changing
            Federal Administrations and financial/economic conditions
            within the government of Brazil (GOB) which placed less
            priority on this sector and the completion of this project.
            Lessons learned from the project were: (a) Appraisal and the
            early stages of implementation did not pay enough attention
            to GOB's commitment to the project and its objectives;
            (b) At appraisal, a project financing plan should carefully
            evaluate the Government's ability -- and willingness --
            to meet counterpart funding requirements; (c) The ability of
            executing agencies to carry out complex engineering works
            and involve beneficiaries in the execution of sub-projects
            at the local level should be evaluated at appraisal and
            monitored during implementation; (d) When rehabilitation
            work is contemplated, experienced specialists in this area
            should be used; (e) The provision of good irrigation systems
            is not sufficient to cause an increase in crop yields,
            change cropping patterns, or improve irrigation techniques;
            (f) In an environment of legal, bureaucratic and
            institutional weakness, technical assistance and support for
            institution building are necessary conditions to improve the
            performance of executing agencies; (g) As was the case for
            this project, when two or more implementing agencies are
            involved, successful implementation depends greatly on good
            collaborative arrangements among them; (h) Confusing and
            contradictory signals by the Bank can undermine a
            borrower's ability to execute a project efficiently.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Upper and Middle Sao Francisco
            Irrigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Upper and Middle Sao Francisco
            Irrigation Project will finance: (i) rehabilitation of seven
            existing irrigation schemes including the installation of
            sprinkler irrigation systems and the rehabilitation of
            access and service roads; (ii) construction of a new Formoso
            A irrigation scheme including pumping stations, irrigation
            and drainage, on-farm works, access and service roads, and
            electrical transmission and distribution lines; (iii)
            provision of operation and maintenance equipment and
            services including construction and equipping of workshops,
            heavy machinery and vehicles, and staff salaries and
            recurrent costs; (iv) extension services to farm families
            including selection and settlement of farmers and training
            in the operation and maintenance of new equipment and
            infrastructure; (v) social services and infrastructure,
            constructiion and repair of schools, health post and social
            service centers, construction of housing, and education
            campaigns against waterborne diseases; (v) medium and long
            term investment credit for farmers to purchase tractors,
            draft animals and related tillage equipment, and to build
            sheds and on-farm grain storage; (vi) staff training and
            technical assistance to provide the skills necessary to
            implement the entire irrigation program.
